resources.string: Octocon is the all-in-one solution for people with dissociative disorders (like DID or OSDD) to manage their alters, find resources, and express themselves.
If not, tap "I'm a singlet" below to hide all system-specific features. You will only be able to add friends to get updates on their front status.\n\nThis can be changed later in the app's settings!
Singlet mode is now enabled. All system-specific features have been hidden. You will only be able to add friends to get updates on their front status.

Please enter your token.

This feature is for testing purposes only. IF YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT THIS MEANS, DO NOT CONTINUE! If someone has asked you to enter a token here, they are trying to scam you.

Once you enter a token, the app will close. You will need to open it again manually.

Join our Patreon to support Octocon's server costs and keep it free for everyone!\n\nYou'll also receive access to cool Discord perks like a special role, priority support, and access to a private Minecraft server.
Support our developer on Ko-fi to help fund their cappuccino addiction!\n\nDonations here go directly to the developer, not the Octocon business.

Octocon will always be free for everyone; we'll **never** introduce features that require payment to use. However, running the app and its servers costs money, so we rely on donations to keep the lights on.

All Patreon donations beyond the server costs are donated to a rotating list of mental health charities.

If you're financially able, please consider supporting us; even the smallest donation means a lot. Thank you.
Your Octocon account on this device is protected with a numerical PIN between 4 and 8 digits. Enter it to continue.

These are settings that only apply to the Octocon Discord bot.

"Alias" is an alternative to this alter's number ID that you specify and can be used in slash commands.

"Proxy name" is an alternative name used when proxying as this alter.
You haven't logged any alters yet!
Log an alter to get started:
Add an alter or create a subtag to get started:
You haven't written any journal entries yet!
Write one now to keep track of your day:
Octocon is an all-in-one toolkit for systems: it lets you manage your alters, set who's fronting, connect with other systems, keep a journal, and much more.
This journal entry is locked. It might contain sensitive information that could worsen your mental state!\n\nAre you sure you want to open it?
No alters are in this tag yet!
You haven't set up any custom fields for your account yet. Check out the settings page to add some:
There are no tags you can attach to this alter.
You have no alters that can be added to this tag.
The alter count above does not include alters that are marked as "Untracked" on their profile.
You have no alters that can vote on this poll.
Are you sure you want to delete this journal entry?
You may add a friend by their username (e.g. "Username") or their ID (e.g. "abcdefg").
This screen only shows alters you have access to view. You shouldn't show this screen to anyone else!
Join our Discord community to get support for the Octocon app.
Invite the Octocon bot to your Discord server to use features such as sending messages as your alters. Everything syncs with the app automatically!
Visit our website to learn more about the Octocon platform and its features.
If you're in immediate danger of harming yourself, an emergency hotline can provide you with the support you need.
If you need someone to talk to, including with LGBTQ+ or addiction issues, consider reaching out to a mental health hotline for help.
did-research.org is a website dedicated to providing information and resources regarding dissociation, trauma, and dissociative disorders.
Learn more about Dissociative Identity Disorder (DID) and its symptoms, including alters and their roles in a system.
Discover the causes and development of dissociative disorders, including the role of childhood trauma.
Explore the comorbidity of dissociative disorders with other mental health conditions, including PTSD and BPD.
Learn about the treatment options available for systems, including suggestions for finding a therapist and managing symptoms.
The external resources listed here are not a substitute for professional medical advice, nor are they affiliated with Octocon.
Octocon offers a variety of features to help you manage your dissociative disorder, including logging fronts, in-app journaling, and front push notifications for your friends.
To get started, we'll have to set a few things up first! Tap the "Next" button below to continue.
Octocon provides a few different methods for managing your front status. Choose the one that works best for you.
Swipe left on an alter to start/stop fronting. Swipe further on a fronting alter to set them as main front.
Swipe left on an alter to start/stop fronting. Swipe right on a fronting alter to set them as main front.
Tap on an alter's arrow button to start/stop fronting. Tap and hold on a fronting alter's button to set them as main front.
Once you start using Octocon, take a look at the Settings page to customize the app to your liking. Tap the button below to join our Discord community if you need help!
If you use Discord, you can invite the Octocon bot to your Discord server to send messages as your alters. Everything syncs with the app automatically!
If you use the Simply Plural app or PluralKit Discord bot, you can import your data (including alters) into Octocon to get started quickly. Just follow the instructions on the Settings page!
Try it out on the alters below!
Use tablet layout on large screens
Hide alters in tags from root
Enter a PIN between 4 and 8 digits below.\n\nThis must be entered every time you open Octocon on this device. If you forget your PIN, you will have to log out!
Stealth mode is now enabled. When you launch the app, you will see a "fake" app that looks like a news aggregator.\n\nTo access the real app, tap the "Octocon" logo at the top of the screen twice.
Quick exit is now enabled. Double-tap anywhere that isn't already interactive (like a button) to immediately exit the app.
Are you sure you want to delete the custom field "%1$s"?
Are you sure you want to delete the tag "%1$s"?
Are you sure you want to delete %1$s?
Are you sure you want to delete the poll "%1$s"?
Are you sure you want to link a Google account to Octocon? You will be redirected to Google's sign-in page.
Are you sure you want to unlink your Google account from Octocon?
Are you sure you want to link a Discord account to Octocon? You will be redirected to Discord's sign-in page.
Are you sure you want to unlink your Discord account from Octocon?
Are you sure you want to log out? This will also reset all of your local device settings.

To import your alters from Simply Plural, you'll need a "token" from Simply Plural first. You can get this by opening the Simply Plural app and navigating to the following page:
~
**Settings** -> **Account** -> **Tokens**
~
From here:
- Click the **Add Token** button
- Enable the **Read** permission
- Click the **Add Token** button at the bottom of the screen
- Tap **Yes** 3 times to confirm
- Click the copy button on the left of the token to copy it to your clipboard
- Enter the token below!

To import your alters from PluralKit, you'll need your PluralKit "token" first.\n~\nTo receive this, DM the PluralKit Discord bot with the command `pk;token`, then copy the long, random string it gives you and enter it below.
Your alters have been successfully imported from Simply Plural!\n~\n**Note:** it may take a while longer for your avatars (profile pictures) to import.
Your alters have been successfully imported from PluralKit!\n~\n**Note:** it may take a while longer for your avatars (profile pictures) to import.
Are you sure you want to reset your device settings? This will not log you out.
Are you sure you want to delete your account? This is irreversible; you CANNOT recover your data after this!
Are you sure you want to delete all of your alters? This is irreversible; you CANNOT recover your old alters after this!
Your Google account was successfully linked!
Your Discord account was successfully linked!
Are you sure you want to delete the choice "%1$s"?
Add a choice to get started:
Add one in the "Settings" tab first.
Create a poll to get started:
No alters have voted on this poll yet!
Cast a vote to get started:
Octocon protects your journal entries with end-to-end encryption for maximum security. To use the journaling feature, you must set up encryption first.
When you tap the button below, you will be shown a recovery code. Write this down and keep it in a safe place!
Write down the recovery code below and keep it in a safe place. You will need this code to access your journal entries on another device.
If you lose this code, you will permanently lose access to your journal entries!
To access your existing journal entries, you'll need to enter your recovery code you wrote down when you set up encryption on another device.
This journal entry was created in a previous version of Octocon and is not end-to-end encrypted. It will be encrypted the next time you save it.
If you've lost your recovery code, you can reset your encryption key. This will permanently delete all of your journal entries, and you will have to start over.
Are you absolutely sure you want to reset your encryption key? This will permanently delete all of your journal entries on all devices!
Enter your recovery code below to recover your encryption key. This will allow you to access your journal entries on this device.

This is a list of your system's friends.

If they have a star next to their name, they are a trusted friend.

You can tap below their name to see who's currently fronting.
This is a view of your front history. You can tap on the arrow buttons to switch between months.
This is a list of your system-wide journal entries.\n\nYou can create a new one by tapping the pencil icon in the bottom-right corner.

This is a list of alters in your system.

Swipe left on an alter to start/stop fronting. Swipe further to set them as main front.

You can hold tap on an alter to see more options.

This is a list of alters in your system.

Swipe left on an alter to start/stop fronting. Swipe right instead to set them as main front.

You can hold tap on an alter to see more options.

This is a list of alters in your system.

Tap on an alter's arrow button to start/stop fronting. Tap and hold on the button to set them as main front.

You can hold tap on an alter to see more options.
Select an alter or tag to get started!
Select a friend to view their alters and tags!
Select a journal entry to start writing!
Select a poll to view or vote on!
Select a submenu to view its settings!
"Main front" refers to the alter who is currently fronting the most. This puts them at the top of the alter list and also enables some Discord features.
Front comments are notes that can be added to an alter whenever they are fronting. They will also appear in the History tab.

A "fronting" alter is one who is currently in control of the body, whether partially or fully. All front changes are permanently logged in the History tab.\n\nYou can use "Set as front" to remove all other alters from front, adding only the selected alter.
Pinning an alter will keep them in a carousel at the top of the alter list, even if they are not fronting. This enables quick access to alters who front frequently.
Deleting an alter will permanently remove them from your system. This action cannot be undone, and all data associated with the alter will be lost.
The home screen is where you can view your system's alters, front history, friends, and journal entries.

"Alters" are the different identities within your system. They can have their own names, pronouns, descriptions, profile pictures, and more.\n\nYou can also add "custom fields" in the app settings to alters to track additional information.
The "History" tab shows a list of all front changes you have ever recorded.

The "Journal" tab is where you can write and save private journal entries. These entries are encrypted and can only be accessed by you.\n\nAlters also have their own journal entries, which can be viewed in the alter's profile.
"Friends" are other systems you have added to your friends list. You can view their alters and tags they have shared with you, as well as who's fronting in their system.

Alter IDs are unique identifiers assigned to each alter in your system. These IDs are used to reference alters in the app and cannot be changed.

IDs are also chronological: an alter with a lower ID was logged before an alter with a higher ID.

If seeing numeric IDs associated with your alters makes you uncomfortable, you can hide them in the app settings (Appearance -> Functionality).

"Tags" are labels (similar to folders) that can be attached to alters to group them together. They can be used to categorize alters by role, age, or any other criteria you choose.\n\nTags can also have "subtags" nested within them to create a hierarchy.

"Polls" are questions you can ask the alters in your system to vote on. There are two types: "vote polls," which represent a simple yes/no question, and "choice polls," which have custom choices for alters to pick from.\n\nPolls can be used to make decisions, gather opinions, or just for fun!
The "Profile" screen is where you can view and edit information about your entire system, such as your username, profile picture, and alter count.
The "Resources" screen is where you can find a variety of external resources related to DID, mental health, and other topics. You can also access the Octocon website and Discord server from here.

The "Settings" screen is where you can customize the app to your liking. You can change the app's appearance, enable accessibility features, and set up security options.\n\nYou can also import alters from other apps, link your Google or Discord account, and miscellaneous information about the app.

If you enjoy using Octocon, consider supporting us by leaving a review on the app store, sharing the app with friends, or donating to our Patreon or Ko-fi. Your support helps us continue to improve the app and provide new features!
This tab contains this alter's basic information, such as their name, pronouns, and profile picture.
Custom fields are additional pieces of information you can add to alters. These can be used to track arbitrary information of your choosing, such as system role, age, and boundaries.

The "Journal" tab is where you can write and save private journal entries for this alter. These entries are encrypted and can only be accessed by you.\n\nThese are separate from system-wide journal entries.
This action will remove this alter from the selected tag. This will not delete the alter or the tag, only the association between them.
This button will revert any changes you have made to this item since it was opened by you. This cannot be undone!
This action will permanently delete this tag from your system. This will not delete any alters, only the tag itself.\n\nAny tags that are immediately under this tag will be moved up one level.
This tab shows all of the alters and subtags that are currently associated with this tag.
This tab allows you to edit this tag's name, color, and parent tag, as well as edit its security level to determine its privacy.
This action will create a new subtag under this tag. Subtags can be used to create a hierarchy of tags, allowing for more complex organization of alters.

The security level of an item determines who can view it. "Public" items can be viewed by anyone, while "Private" items can only be viewed by you.\n\nMark an item as "Friends only" to have it be viewable by your friends, or "Trusted only" to have it be viewable by only your trusted friends.
This action will permanently delete this front entry from your system. This will not delete the associated alter, only the front entry itself.

Trusted friends are friends you have explicitly marked as "trusted." This allows them to access any items you have marked with the "Trusted only" security level, in addition to "Friends only."\n\nTrusted friends appear with a star next to their name.
This action will remove this friend from your friends list. They will immediately lose access to any alters or tags you have shared with them.
Alters can have an avatar, which is a profile picture that represents them. Your chosen avatar will be uploaded to our servers and lightly compressed.
Your profile can have an avatar, which is a profile picture that represents you to others. Your chosen avatar will be uploaded to our servers and lightly compressed.
The alter count is the total number of alters you have logged in your system. This includes all alters except for those marked as "Untracked" on their profile.
This category contains settings pertaining to the look and feel of the app.
This category contains settings that can help make the app easier to use for those with disabilities or impairments.
This category contains settings that help keep your data secure and private. These settings are especially useful for those in abusive environments.
When enabled, you will receive push notifications from Octocon. These notifications currently alert you when the front status of a friend has changed.

You can link your Google account to Octocon to allow signing in with Google. Octocon cannot access your Google account data; it only collects your email address.\n\nYou must have your account linked to at least one sign-in method (Google or Discord) at all times.

You can link your Discord account to Octocon to allow signing in with Discord and link your system with the Octocon Discord bot. Octocon cannot access your Discord account data; it only collects your Discord user ID.\n\nYou must have your account linked to at least one sign-in method (Google or Discord) at all times.

You can import your alters from the Simply Plural app into Octocon. To do this, you will need a "token" from Simply Plural, which you can get from the app's settings.\n\nThis will import all of your alters, including their names, pronouns, and profile pictures.

You can import your alters from the PluralKit Discord bot into Octocon. To do this, you will need a "token" from PluralKit, which you can get by DMing the PluralKit bot with the command `pk;token`.\n\nThis will import all of your alters, including their names, pronouns, and profile pictures.
This action will reset all of your device settings to their default values. This will not log you out of the app, or reset any settings that are synced across devices (such as custom fields).
This action will permanently delete your account and all associated data. You will be logged out of the app and all data will be permanently lost.
This action will permanently delete all of your alters from your system. This will not delete any other data, only the alters themselves.
This screen contains a list of all open source libraries and software used by the Octocon app.
This button opens a link to the Octocon server status page. If the app is misbehaving, you can check here to see if our servers are down or under maintenance!
This setting controls the color mode of the app. "Same as device" will match the setting on your device, while "Light" and "Dark" will force the app to use those modes.

This setting controls the primary color of the app. Choose a color that you like, and the app will change its color to match.\n\nIf "Dynamic color type" is not "None," alters, tags, and journal entries will override this color with their own.

This setting controls whether or not alters, tags, and journal entries will use their own colors instead of the app-wide theme color.

"None" will use the theme color across the entire app.

"Normal" will use a slightly muted shade of an item's color when viewing that item.

"Vibrant" uses each item's exact hex code as the basis for the color.
When enabled, the app will use a completely black background (i.e. hex #000000). This saves battery life on devices with AMOLED screens.

This setting controls which gestures you use to change the front status of alters in your system.

"Swipe" adds or removes an alter from front when swiping left on them, or sets them as main front if you swipe left even further.

"Swipe (Bidirectional)" adds or removes an alter from front when swiping left on them, or sets them as main front if you swipe right instead.

"Button" adds or removes an alter from front when tapping on their arrow button, or sets them as main front if you tap and hold on the button.

This setting controls whether or not numeric IDs are shown next to alters in the app. These IDs are used to reference alters in the app and Discord bot and cannot be changed.\n\nIf seeing numeric IDs associated with your alters makes you uncomfortable, you can enable this setting to hide them across the entire app.

When enabled, alters that are part of at least one tag are shown in the root alter list. If enabled, alters that are part of at least one tag will only be accessible through those tags. This can help keep your alter list clean and organized.
When enabled, the app will modify its layout to better suit larger screens, such as tablets, foldable devices, or desktops. Disable this to use the phone layout on all devices.
This setting controls the style of the corners of the app. "Rounded" will round the corners of various UI elements, while "Square" will keep them sharp.

When enabled, the app will slightly shrink the avatars of alters in the alter list. Alters in the pinned alters carousel will also be smaller.\n\nThis can assist those with visual impairments by simplifying the UI.

When enabled, most screens in the app will show a small, permanent tooltip at the top of the screen.\n\nThese tooltips provide helpful information about the screen you're currently viewing and how to interact with it, and are especially useful for those with heavy dissociative amnesia.

This setting controls the font used throughout the app. "Default" will use Octocon's built-in fonts, while "Lexie Readable" and "OpenDyslexic" will use those fonts instead.\n\nThese alternate fonts are designed to be more legible for those with dyslexia; users have reported better success with Lexie Readable in particular.
This setting controls the size of the font used throughout the app. Try adjusting this if you find text difficult to read.
This setting controls the contrast level of the app. The app was designed with "Normal" contrast in mind, so some UI elements may not look as intended.

This setting controls the amount of motion & animations used in the app. When enabled, the app will use less intense screen transitions, and disable certain types of animations.\n\nThis can help reduce motion sickness for some users.

Spotlight is a feature that provides helpful tooltips for almost every interactive part of the app. These tooltips can be accessed by holding tap on an item for a short duration.\n\nYou're reading a Spotlight tooltip right now!
This setting controls how long you need to hold tap on an item to access a Spotlight tooltip. The duration ranges from 500 milliseconds ("Shorter") to 2 seconds ("Longer").

When enabled, the app will require you to enter a PIN every time you open it. This can help keep your data secure from prying eyes.\n\nIf you forget your PIN, you will have no choice but to log out of the app.

When enabled, the app will disguise itself as a "fake" news aggregator when launched. To access the real app, tap the Octocon logo at the top of the screen twice.\n\nThis can help keep your system's existence private from others who may use or confiscate your device, and provide plausible deniability.

When enabled, you can quickly exit the app by double-tapping anywhere that isn't already interactive (like a button). This can help you quickly exit the app in an emergency, such as if you realize someone is looking over your shoulder.
When enabled, the app will hide all system-specific features, such as alters, tags, front history, and polls. You will only be able to edit your profile and view your friends' profiles.
This action will log you out of the app and reset all of your local device settings. This will not delete your account or any data stored on the server.
